name: Raymond Strange
summary: Accomplished Operation Management professional with 20+ years of experience driving process improvements, financial administration, and staff productivity in military environments. Skilled in contract negotiation, project management, policy/program development, and overseeing HR/financial/accounting and inventory control across operations.

experience.title: Operation Manager
experience.description: Coordinates training of 3000+ employees within the regional footprint with 100% mission completion. Ensures policy compliance; led staff training initiatives to maximize productivity. Analyzes business drivers and summarizes results into presentations. Drafts office job descriptions and directives. Develops and executes marketing programs and general business solutions increasing regional exposure, customer traffic, and tracking systems. Financial responsibilities include authorizing funds for TDY travel, owning accounting, forecasting, and strategic supply planning; forecasts operating costs for scheduled projects and manages high volumes of financial activity in a fast-paced environment.

experience.title: General Manager
experience.description: Managed Quality Control, Unit Supply, Aviation Automated Logistical Supply, Production Control, and Administration. Assisted with planning, organizing, directing, and supervising company-level training; oversaw monthly reports. Managed training calendars and forecast requirements. Managed Defense Travel Management System and Army Training Requirements and Resource System; proficient with Microsoft-based programs. Coordinated internal activity between Company and Battalion staff and supervised preparation and maintenance of unit movement and unit load plans and their execution.

experience.title: Logistic Manager
experience.description: Coordinated and managed resident training activities in aviation logistics and maintenance, including resource utilization, facilities upkeep, modernization, and establishing new facility requirements to maintain training quality. Identified un-programmed requirements and training constraints; synchronized training and support schedules; tracked and resolved support failures; de-conflicted class, equipment, and facilities schedules and instructor requirements. Coordinated on-site instruction for Active Army and Reserve components via Displaced Equipment and New Equipment Training Teams.

experience.title: Senior Training Specialist
experience.description: Training Instructor and subject matter expert in the Structural Branch (SPD). Managed course materials for blocks of instruction, provided training materials and aids, conducted platform instruction, and administered practical exercises and examinations. Proctored written and performance examinations. Evaluated and certified training instructors as a Senior Evaluator. Trained Initial Entry Level, intermediate, and advanced courses for National Guard, Reserve Component, Foreign National, and Active Duty Soldiers.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Business Administration

certifications: Professional Development (United States Army) - Structured Self Development [2013]
Aircraft Component Repairer Supervisor Senior LDR [2007]
